title: Save Big On Xbox Game Pass Ultimate Ahead Of Call Of Duty: Black Ops 6's Friday Launch
description: Xbox Game Pass Ultimate 3-Month Prepaid Code Save big at Woot: $36.49 | Compared to: $50 on Amazon, $60 on Xbox Store See at Woot See at Amazon 3-Month PC Game Pass Subscription $30 | Save $6 compared to Microsoft's monthly price See at Amazon Once again, Amazon-owned retailer Woot has a stellar deal on Xbox Game Pass Ultimate subscriptions, just in time for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6's October 25 launch. Until the end of the month while supplies last, you can snag 3-Month Xbox Game Pass Ultimate codes for only $36.49 and 1-Month codes for $13.79. You'd spend $60 for three months directly from the Xbox Store or $50 for a prepaid code at major retailers, so you're saving anywhere from $13.50 to $23.48, depending on how you normally pay for Game Pass Ultimate. See at Woot Black Ops 6 will be added to the Game Pass Ultimate library on launch day. Subscribers can play the new FPS on Xbox Series X|S, Xbox One, PC, and Xbox Cloud Gaming without needing to buy a copy of the game.If you've never shopped at Woot, you can sign in using your Amazon account. When placing your order, you will need to input your shipping address, but the codes will be delivered to your email. Woot sends a shipping confirmation email with a "tracking number" shortly after your order is finalized. The tracking number is actually the 25-character key that you need to redeem on the Xbox Store.Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Elden Ring Books Of Knowledge Volume 3 Releases On Halloween, Preorders Discounted At Amazon
description: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree - Books of Knowledge, Volume 3 $34.74 (was $45) Preorder at Amazon See Vol. 1 at Amazon See Vol. 2 at Amazon Preorders for the official Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree strategy guide are on sale for $34.74 (was $45) at Amazon. Originally slated for September 30, the book was quietly pushed back to October 31. The hardcover book is Volume 3 in the highly rated Books of Knowledge guidebook series published by Future Press. If you're interested in adding the book to your shelf, we'd highly recommend preordering, as there's no guarantee the book will remain available for long after its release. Volume 1 and Volume 2 in the Books of Knowledge series have been sold out for months, and it's unclear if they will be printed again. At this time, you can only buy the first two volumes from resellers in new or preowned condition. Elden Ring Books at Amazon We gathered every official Elden Ring book you can buy in one place on Amazon Browse at Amazon Shadow of the Erdtree's guide is releasing on the heels of the massive 744-page Bloodborne Complete Guide, which was published by Future Press on October 15 and is in stock for $54 (was $60) at Amazon.Elden Ring Books of Knowledge SeriesElden Ring Official Strategy Guide Volume 1 (Hardcover) -- Sold out (third-party listings)Elden Ring Official Strategy Guide Volume 2 (Hardcover) -- Sold out (third-party listings)Elden Ring Official Strategy Guide Volume 3 (Hardcover) -- $34.74 ($45) | Releases October 31In better news, both official Elden Ring Art Books have been restocked at Amazon and are on sale for steep discounts. Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume I offers an in-depth look at the The Lands Between's sprawling open world, dungeons, main characters and NPCs, and armor. Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume II, meanwhile, focuses on the bosses and other enemies you encounter as well as the wide array of weapons you can wield. Together, the two hardcovers eclipse 800 pages and include a bounty of stunning artwork and lore. You can grab both volumes for roughly $77 total (combined value is $120).Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Halloween Is Frighteningly Close, And You Still Don’t Have A Costume — Let’s Change That
description: Halloween is on a Thursday this year, which means those parties you’ll be hitting will arrive almost a full week earlier than the spooktacular holiday. With the festivities beginning as early as Friday, October 25, your annual chance at costumed debauchery is frighteningly close, and you have even less time to…Read more...

title: I Have A Complicated Relationship With Dragon Ball: Sparking! Zero
description: I’ve been a grumpy old man about all things Dragon Ball for far too long. As your typical non-manga-reading, mainstream-anime-watching child of Toonami, I drew a line in the sand a few episodes into Dragon Ball Super when I first gave it a chance. title: Japanese Rural Life Adventure is exactly what it sounds like and more
description: Japanese Rural Life Adventure is what it says on the tin — it’s a 16-bit-style farming sim that takes place in the countryside, and it’s filled with hallmarks of the genre: You leave the city to arrive at a broken-down farm that you revitalize as you meet the townsfolk and become a part of their […]

description: Do you feel that? That chill in the air, that tingling sensation at the back of your neck? It can only mean one thing. That’s right: Halloween season is once again upon us! title: What's on your bookshelf?: slightly useful useless edition
description: No cool industry person this week, I’m afraid, but I do have a consolation prize for you. A comment from valued RPS community member #1694 a few weeks back reminded me that I once spent a long time tracking down good SF/Fantasy/Horror short story magazines. Partly for pitching purposes, and partly because I was just really excited such things still existed. Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: The Sunday Papers
description: Sundays are for reconnecting with old friends, reminiscing about good times, and eventually going to bed feeling an unbelievable sense of calm, contentment, and a newly invigorated sense of self. Lol nah I’m going to play Mechabellum and eat gnocchi from a packet. Asda’s vegan pumpkin pesto is very good though. Here’s some writing I personally found interesting about games (and game related things!) Read more
author: Nic Reuben

title: Two Weeks into the Great Tenerifis Migration – Taking the Regional Gate
description: For those just joining, Goonswarm Federation, a 48,000 capsuleer strong null sec alliance, is moving from its home in Delve to Tenerifis and regions east, which might be the largest peacetime logistical operation in the history of New Eden.  I have seen so many freighters, jump freighters, Rorquals, and other haulers on the move it […]

title: Are We Still Binge Watching? Yes, We are Still Binge Watching!
description: Honestly, we never stopped.  I just keep starting posts about shows. forget about them, then find them in my drafts folder months later and realize that the show in question hasn’t really stuck… and where was I? Oh yeah, so I haven’t written one of these since back in January, which means I’ve probably forgotten […]
